2]] - After visiting friends in [[Bournemouth]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] becomes ill and dies, at the age of eighty-one. He is buried next to his wife, [[Edith Tolkien
6]]''' - A requiem Mass for [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] is held in the Church of St Anthony of Padua in Headington, [[Oxford]]. Father [[Robert Murray]] assists.
28]]''' - The ''[http://www.nationalreview.com/flashback/flashback200510030823.asp National Review]'' publishes an article on [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s death.
